alert.note: Alert for Custer (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 31 at 10:36PM CDT until June 01 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 AM CDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western Oklahoma, including the following counties, Custer and Roger Mills. * WHEN...Until 430 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1035 PM CDT, gauge reports indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain fell earlier Tuesday evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Thomas, Arapaho, Hammon, Custer City, Butler, Foss Reservoir, Moorewood and Stafford. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
